sub_topic: Finding the determinant of a matrix
message_1:
Find the determinant of the following 3 x 3 matrix:

$$\begin{vmatrix} 2 & 3 & 5 \\ 1 & 0 & 2 \\ -3 & 4 & 1 \end{vmatrix}$$
message_2:
To find the determinant of a 3 x 3 matrix, we can use the following formula:

$$\det(A) = a(ei - fh) - b(di - fg) + c(dh - eg)$$

where the matrix A is:

$$\begin{vmatrix} a & b & c \\ d & e & f \\ g & h & i \end{vmatrix}$$

In our case, the matrix is:

$$\begin{vmatrix} 2 & 3 & 5 \\ 1 & 0 & 2 \\ -3 & 4 & 1 \end{vmatrix}$$

So, we have:

$$a = 2, b = 3, c = 5, d = 1, e = 0, f = 2, g = -3, h = 4, i = 1$$

Now, we can plug these values into the formula:

$$\det(A) = 2(0 - 8) - 3(2 - 6) + 5(4 - 0)$$

$$\det(A) = 2(-8) - 3(-4) + 5(4)$$

$$\det(A) = -16 + 12 + 20$$

$$\det(A) = 16$$

So, the determinant of the given matrix is 16.
